lines.text: Excuse me, guys... can I see your invitations?
Is this your house?
Yes.
Your party?
Yes.
Can we get in?
No.
C'mon Brad, let's just go.
No no no no... Steve... Steve, we can get in, right?
You don't got an invitation. You don't go in.
You don't GOT an invitation? Steve, quick English lesson; it's don't HAVE an invitation. As in 'Hi, my name is Steve. I don't have brain.'
You're just a natural little Shakestein, aren't you?
Shakespeare, Steve... it's Shakespeare. Didn't you see the 'No Idiots' sign on the front lawn?
What do you mean we're having the bedroom redone? We just had it redone last week.
I'm having it redone... redone.
Should I bother to ask why?
Well, I just read that Sharon Stone is having her bedroom redone in imperial blue. So... I want imperial blue.
Keeping up with the Stoneses?
Hi.
So, hows your uncle?
On his way to a full recovery.
And how are you doing?
Just fine... Tiger.
Tiger?
Yeah, that's what I'm gonna call you from now on. Like, your nickname.
Mm, so we're giving nicknames now, huh? Well, can I call you Schnookums?
Schnookums? Sounds like an air freshener.
[pause]
Well, this has definitely been one of the most exciting summers I've ever had.
Yeah. Wonder if it gets any better?
You know it does.
Let me drive, Brad.
No, you can NOT drive! Did you see what I had to go through to GET these keys? I have to eat vegetables!
You can rape, kill, torture a few little kids and blow up a few mailboxes... but just keep it in the neighborhood, okay?
Either Mr. Johnson turned into a pretty young woman last night... or he's been hiding something from us.
There are two things in the world I can't stand; flat soda... and big slimy guys with tattoos.
That guy is such a jerk.
Hey, forget him. He's just compensating for a tiny...
Nose!
You gotta match?
Yeah, my ass and your face.
Bug off, worm!
If I wanted a heart attack, I would've had one myself!
This place looks like a ninja pajama party.
